item.title: Question about procedures
item.dc:creator: @hey321 hey321
item.description:
@hey321 wrote:

Also, if you did this:

Program hey;

procedure a;
begin
writeln(‘1’);
end;

procedure a9;
begin
writeln(‘2’);
end;

begin
Repeat
a9;
a;
a9;
Until(False)
end.

It would repeat it because the repeat until tells it to ;).

Read full topic

item.title: Question about procedures
item.dc:creator: @m0u53m4t m0u53m4t
item.description:
@m0u53m4t wrote:

Yeah, Findbitmaptolerance is right. Press f1 to find out the commands.

If you type that procedure name, it will run that procedure only and then continue in your script. So if this was my code:

procedure 1a;
begin
writeln(‘1’)
end;

procedure 2a;
begin
writeln(‘2’)
end;

begin
2a
1a
2a
end.

It would write “2” then “1”, as indicated by the next call to the 1a command, then “2” again, because of the final command. Understand?

Read full topic

item.title: Question about procedures
item.dc:creator: @Macro_FTW Macro_FTW
item.description:
@Macro_FTW wrote:

I know this question is really basic, but I need to know it for a script I am making…

Say I have this scar code:

[code]Procedure Getacolor(x,y);
begin
getcolor(x,y)
end;

Procedure Findbitmap;
begin
Example := bitmapfromstring (1, 1, 1gd81td37fd23g1293713582gd2kdhw1236e810g);
If(findbitmap(example,x,y))then
Getacolor(x,y);
end;

begin
Findbitmap;
end.
[/code]
If I did the getacolor(x,y); would that bring the script back to the ‘Findbitmap’ procedure to do the next step after the ‘Getacolor(x,y);’ procedure?

EDIT: also, is the command for finding a bitmap with tolerence… well… Findbitmaptolerence?

Thanks for any help!
~Macro~

Read full topic
